page.title: 09STATELY HOUSES,MEDMENHAM
page.content: {DANESFIELD HOUSE { }The grounds of the house,built between 1899-1901,sweep down to the Thames.The estate has 63 acres,including 30 acres of woodland,a swimming pool and tennis court.It was built for a Midlands millionaire but is now office accommodation for Carnation Food products who employ 180 staff.As Carnation have been taken over by Nestles the building will be up for sale. {WITTINGTON HOUSE It was formerly built by a biscuit magnate as a private residence.Until recently it has been rented by The Salvation Army and run as an old peoples home.It is currently up for sale and will probably be used for office accommodation. {HARLEYFORD MANOR See page 13
